Yourself, your queen, your son.
Yourself, assisted with your honour'd friends,
Yourself into a power tyrannical;
Yours, if you talk of tails: and so farewell.
Your worship is deceived; the gown is made
Your worship in that sense may call him 'man.'
Your worship had like to have given us one, if you
Your wonder: but yet speak; first, you, my liege,
Your wives shall welcome home the conquerors;
Your will be done: this must my comfort be,
Your wife, your son, these senators, the nobles;
Your widow-dolour likewise be unwept!
Your well defended honour, you must pardon
Your voices: for your voices I have fought;
Your voices therefore.' When we granted that,
Your very worshipful and loving friends,
Your valour puts well forth: pray, follow.
Your unknown sovereignty!
Your uncle York is join'd with Bolingbroke,
Your tributary drops belong to woe,
Your tongue, though but bastards and syllables
Your temples burned in their cement, and
Your tale, sir, would cure deafness.
Your suit's unprofitable; stand up, I say.
Your suffering in this dearth, you may as well
Your sued-for tongues?
Your sudden approbation.
Your stinking greasy caps in hooting at
Your state of fortune and your due of birth,
Your son, George Stanley: look your faith be firm.
Your son shall have my daughter with consent.
Your soldiers use him as the grace 'fore meat,
Your ships are stay'd at Venice, and the duke,
Your sense pursues not mine: either you are ignorant,
Your safety manifested.
Your sad tires in a mile-a.
Your royal ear abused. First, hath this woman
Your right of birth, your empery, your own.
Your right depends not on his life or death.
Your resolution cannot hold, when 'tis
Your reasons are too shallow and too quick.
Your queen and I are devils: yet go on;
Your purse is not hot enough to purchase your spice.
Your provost knows the place where he abides
Your princely father and my loving lord!
Your presence makes us rich, most noble lord.
Your precious self had then not cross'd the eyes
Your praises are too large: but that your youth,
Your plaintain-leaf is excellent for that.
Your plainness and your shortness please me well.
Your person most, that he would pawn his fortunes
Your partner, as I hear, must die to-morrow,
Your part in her you could not keep from death,
Your pardon, sir; for this
Your own is yours, and I am yours, and all.
Your own desert!
Your only choice.
Your oath, my lord, is vain and frivolous.
Your native town you enter'd like a post,
Your multiplying spawn how can he flatter--
Your mother.
Your mother well hath pray'd, and prove you true.
Your mother was most true to wedlock, prince;
Your mother lives a witness to that vow--
Your most sweet voices: now you have left
Your most obedient counsellor, yet that dare
Your most grave belly was deliberate,
Your mistress' name?
Your mind from feasting. Sooth, when I was young
Your mere enforcement shall acquittance me
Your maidenheads growing: O Proserpina,
Your loving motion toward the common body,
Your love says, like an honest gentleman, and a
Your love deserves my thanks; but my desert
Your looks are pale and wild, and do import
Your lives shall pay the forfeit of the peace.
Your liberties and the charters that you bear
Your legs did better service than your hands.
Your lecture shall have leisure for as much.
Your lady's love against some other maid
Your lady mother is coming to your chamber:
Your lack of love or bounty, you were straited
Your knees to them, not arms, must help. Alack,
Your knees to me? to your corrected son?
Your knee, sirrah.
Your king and Warwick's, and must have my will.
Your kindness better.
Your joys with like relation. Go together,
Your ignorant election; enforce his pride,
Your ignorance, which finds not till it feels,
Your husband, he is gone to save far off,
Your husband, being troubled with a shrew,
Your husband so much sweat. Cominius,
Your horse stands ready at the park-corner.
Your horror's pardon:
Your honour's players, heating your amendment,
Your honour with your form.
Your honour not o'erthrown by your desires,
Your honour hath no shriving work in hand.
Your honour and your goodness is so evident
Your highness told me I should post before.
Your highness to assign our trial day.
Your highness shall repose you at the Tower:
Your highness shall do well to grant her suit;
Your highness said even now, I made you a duke:
Your highness aims at, if I aim aright.
Your high displeasure: all this uttered
Your heaviest censure.
Your hearts of sorrow and your eyes of tears:
Your heart is full of something that does take
Your hand, my Perdita: so turtles pair,
Your guest, then, madam:
Your grant, or your denial, shall be mine:
Your gracious self, embrace but my direction:
Your gracious self to take on you the charge
Your grace, we think, should soonest know his mind.
Your grace's pardon, and I hope I had it.
Your grace mistakes; only to be brief
Your grace may do your pleasure.
Your grace hath still been famed for virtuous;
Your grace attended to their sugar'd words,
Your gates against my force. Yet, for I loved thee,
Your friends, sir; the hangman. You must be so
Your friends at Pomfret, they do need the priest;
Your friends are up, and buckle on their armour.
Your friar is now your prince: as I was then
Your franchises, whereon you stood, confined
Your followers I will whisper to the business,
Your first is dead; or 'twere as good he were,
Your fire-new stamp of honour is scarce current.
Your fellow tribune.
Your fellow Tranio here, to save my life,
Your father's image is so hit in you,
Your father's head, which Clifford placed there;
Your eyes drop millstones, when fools' eyes drop tears:
Your eyes do menace me: why look you pale?
Your eye hath too much youth in't: not a month
Your enigma?
Your enemies, with nodding of their plumes,
Your enemies and his find something in him.
Your discontenting father strive to qualify
Your differences shall all rest under gage
Your dicipline in war, wisdom in peace,
Your dangerous lenity. If you are learn'd,
Your crown content and you must be contented
Your country's fat shall pay your pains the hire;
Your company to the Capitol; where, I know,
Your colder reasons.
Your choice is not so rich in worth as beauty,
Your children's children quit it in your age.
Your children yet unborn and unbegot,
Your children were vexation to your youth,
Your changed complexions are to me a mirror
Your cares set up do not pluck my cares down.
Your care is gain of care, by new care won:
Your brows are blacker; yet black brows, they say,
Your brother's son shall never reign our king;
Your brother's death, I know, sits at your heart;
Your brother is to die.
Your brother is imprison'd by your means,
Your brother is a forfeit of the law,
Your brother dies to-morrow; be content.
Your brother and his lover have embraced:
Your brother Richard mark'd him for the grave:
Your bounty, virtue, fair humility:
Your blunt upbraidings and your bitter scoffs:
Your betters have endured me say my mind,
Your belly's answer? What!
Your bed-chamber.
Your beauty: which did haunt me in my sleep
Your beauty was the cause of that effect;
Your ancient, trusty, pleasant servant Grumio.
Your affairs there, what, with whom, the condition
Your aery buildeth in our aery's nest.
Your actions are my dreams;
Your Rome about your ears.
Your Coriolanus
Youngling, thou canst not love so dear as I.
Younger than she are happy mothers made.

You wrong me, Signior Gremio: give me leave.

You would entreat me rather go than stay.

You will not own it.

You will have Gremio to keep you fair.

You will be there, I know.

You tempt him over-much.

You speak too bitterly.
You speak o' the people,
You speak as if that I had slain my cousins.
You speak a language that I understand not:
You soothed not, therefore hurt not: but
You something know; yet I believe there comes
You so remain.

You sleep in peace, the tyrant being slain;
You show too much of that

You say well.

You saw my master wink and laugh upon you?

You promised, when you parted with the king,
You promised knighthood to our forward son:

You pluck a thousand dangers on your head,

You pay a great deal too dear for what's given freely.
You offer him, if this be so, a wrong
You never spoke what did become you less

You need not fear it, sir:

You may deny that you were not the cause
You may be jogging whiles your boots are green;
You make strong party, or defend yourself
You make my bonds still greater.
You make a leg, and Bolingbroke says ay.
You love the breeder better than the male.
You lose a thousand well-disposed hearts
You lords and heads o' the state, perfidiously
You look as if you held a brow of much distraction
You logger-headed and unpolish'd grooms!
You live that shall cry woe for this after.
You lie.
You lie, in faith; for you are call'd plain Kate,
You left poor Henry at the Bishop's palace,
You know your father's temper: at this time
You know to-morrow is the wedding-day.

You do the nobler.
You do not purpose to him; and as hardly
You do him wrong, surely.
You do him injury to scorn his corse.
You do but lose your labour.
You do blaspheme the good in mocking me.
You do awake your faith. Then all stand still;
You did mistake.
You did continue fault and that you slipp'd not
You cry against the noble senate, who,
You cram these words into mine ears against
You common cry of curs! whose breath I hate
You cloudy princes and heart-sorrowing peers,
You chose her; then I'ld shriek, that even your ears
You cavil, widow: I did mean, my queen.
You cannot tent yourself: be gone, beseech you.
You cannot guess who caused your father's death.
You cannot guess wherefore the Welshman comes.
You break not sanctuary in seizing him.
You break no privilege nor charter there.
You break into some merry passion
You bless me, gods!
You bid me seek redemption of the devil:
You bid me make it orderly and well,
You being their mouths, why rule you not their teeth?
You are well met, sir. You denied to fight with me
You are welcome, sir.
You are welcome, gentlemen! come, musicians, play.
You are welcome all.
You are very sensible, and yet you miss my sense:
You are transported by calamity
You are too senseless--obstinate, my lord,
You are too hot.
You are too blunt: go to it orderly.
You are too absolute;
You are to blame, my lord, to rate her so.

You are the king King Edward hath deposed;

You are still crossing it. Sirs, let't alone:

You are sent for to the Capitol. 'Tis thought
You are pleasant, sir, and speak apace.

You are one of those
You are old enough now, and yet, methinks, you lose.
You are never without your tricks: you may, you may.

You are most welcome home.
You are married?

You are like to do such business.
You are i' the right, sir: 'tis for my mistress.

You are come to Sandal in a happy hour;
You are at point to lose your liberties:
You are all resolved rather to die than to famish?

You are a saucy boy: is't so, indeed?
You are a lover; borrow Cupid's wings,
You are a Roman, are you?
You and your crafts! you have crafted fair!

You adopt your policy, how is it less or worse,

You Capulet; shall go along with me:

York and young Rutland could not satisfy.

Yonder comes news. A wager they have met.
Yond crickets shall not hear it.
Yon light is not day-light, I know it, I:

Yield, Marcius, yield!

Yet,--
Yet, were there but this single plot to lose,

Yet, Warwick, in despite of all mischance,
Yet, Marcius, that was much. Your hand: most welcome!
Yet, Derby, notwithstanding she's your wife,
Yet your good will
Yet you are wither'd.
Yet would you say ye were beaten out of door;
Yet witness what you hear we did intend:
Yet who's so blind, but says he sees it not?
Yet whether you accept our suit or no,
Yet to draw forth your noble ancestry
Yet to beat down these rebels here at home.
Yet thus far fortune maketh us amends,
Yet this good comfort bring I to your grace,
Yet that, by you deposed, you quake like rebels?
Yet that thy brazen gates of heaven may ope,
Yet tell me not, for I have heard it all.
Yet standing in rich place, I multiply
Yet so much is my poverty of spirit,
Yet show some pity.
Yet shall you have all kindness at my hand
Yet see no shelter to avoid the storm;
Yet read the gamut of Hortensio.
Yet put it out, for I would not be seen.
Yet parted but the shadow with his hand.
Yet one word more: grief boundeth where it falls,
Yet one time he did call me by my name:
Yet one thing more, good Blunt, before thou go'st,
Yet oftentimes he goes but mean-apparell'd.
Yet of your royal presence I'll adventure
Yet not so wealthy as an English yeoman.
Yet not so deeply as to thee belongs,
Yet none of you would once plead for his life.
Yet never means to wed where he hath woo'd.
Yet neither conqueror nor conquered:
Yet nature's tears are reason's merriment.
Yet nature might have made me as these are,
Yet nature is made better by no mean
Yet most suspected, as the time and place
Yet may he live awhile; and, it may be,
Yet looks he like a king: behold, his eye,
Yet look to have them buzz to offend thine ears.
Yet lives our pilot still. Is't meet that he
Yet let us all together to our troops,
Yet let me weep for such a feeling loss.
Yet know, my master, God omnipotent,
Yet in this one thing let me blame your grace,
Yet if thy thoughts, Bianca, be so humble
Yet here Prince Edward stands, King Henry's son.
Yet heavens are just, and time suppresseth wrongs.
Yet he would be king on't.
Yet he shall have a noble memory. Assist.
Yet he is come.
Yet hath he in him such a mind of honour.
Yet hasty marriage seldom proveth well.
Yet had not we determined he should die,
Yet give leave, my lord,
Yet from my dugs he drew not this deceit.
Yet for this once, yea, superstitiously,
Yet extreme gusts will blow out fire and all:
Yet execute thy wrath in me alone,
Yet did repent me, after more advice;
Yet can I not of such tame patience boast
Yet camest thou to a morsel of this feast,
Yet blessing on his heart that gives it me!
Yet best beseeming me to speak the truth.
Yet ask.
Yet art thou slain in him: thou dost consent
Yet are they passing cowardly. But, I beseech you,
Yet am I sick for fear: speak it again;
Yet am I arm'd against the worst can happen;
Yet again! what do you here? Shall we give o'er
Yet I wish, sir,--
Yet I should kill thee with much cherishing.
Yet I have faced it with a card of ten.
Yet I confess that often ere this day,
Yet I can make my audit up, that all
Yet Edward at the least is Duke of York.
Yet 'banished'? Hang up philosophy!
Yes; keep you warm.
Yes; if there were no other excuse why they should
Yes; I do think that you might pardon him,
Yes. Has he affections in him,
Yes, worthy sir,
Yes, truly; I speak not as desiring more;
Yes, that thou hast, whether thou art tainted or free.
Yes, one place else, if you will hear me name it.
Yes, my good lord,
Yes, mercy, if you report him truly.
Yes, marry, did I but I was fain to forswear it;
Yes, madam: yet I cannot choose but laugh,
Yes, in good sooth, the vice is of a great kindred;
Yes, if you will, my lord.
Yes, he would give't thee, from this rank offence,
Yes, faith, sir.
Yes, faith, and all his lords; the Duke of Milan
Yes, certain, there's a letter for you; I saw't.
Yes, by Saint Anne, do I. A good matter, surely:
Yes, brother, you may live:
Yes, better, sir.
Yes, as I love the woman that wrong'd him.
Yes, an't please you, sir.
Yes, Warwick, I remember it to my grief;
Yes, Warwick, Edward dares, and leads the way.
Yes, I know thee to be Signior Lucentio.
Yes, I agree, and thank you for your motion.
Yes, I accept her, for she well deserves it;
Yes, Caliban her son.
Yea.
Yea, scandalous to the world.
Yea, say you so?
Yea, noise? then I'll be brief. O happy dagger!
Yea, my lord. How brooks your grace the air,
Yea, my good lord.
Yea, look'st thou pale? let me see the writing.
Yea, leave that labour to great Hercules;
Yea, is the worst well? very well took, i' faith;
Yea, his dread trident shake.
Yea, distaff-women manage rusty bills
Yea, but not change his spots: take but my shame.
Yea, brother of Clarence, are thou here too?
Yea, brother Richard, are you offended too?
Yea, at all points; and longs to enter in.
Yea, are you so brief?
Yea, and to marry her, if her dowry please.
Yea, and perhaps with more successful words
Yea, and much more: but I was born so high,
Yea, and much better blood than his or thine.
Yea, and forswore himself,--which Jesu pardon!--
Yea, all my raiment, to my petticoat;
Yea, Richard, when I know; for I protest
Yea even my foes will shed fast-falling tears,
Ye're long about it.
Ye shall, my Lord.
Ye see, I drink the water of mine eyes.
Ye say honestly: rest you merry!
Ye re goodly things, you voices!
Ye favourites of a king: are we not high?
Ye cannot reason almost with a man
Ye are a baggage: the Slys are no rogues; look in

YORK:
Wrong not her birth, she is of royal blood.
Wrong hath but wrong, and blame the due of blame.
Write up his title with usurping blood.
Write sorrow on the bosom of the earth,
Write in the dust this sentence with thy blood,
Writ in remembrance more than things long past:
Wretches so quake: they kneel, they kiss the earth;
Wrench up thy power to the highest.
Wrench awe from fools and tie the wiser souls
Wrecked the same instant of their master's death and
Wrath-kindled gentlemen, be ruled by me;
Wrath makes him deaf: speak thou, Northumberland.
Wrapp'd in sweet clothes, rings put upon his fingers,
Wouldst thou withdraw it? for what purpose, love?
Wouldst thou have laugh'd had I come coffin'd home,
Wouldst have me weep? why, now thou hast thy will:
Would, with themselves, shut up my thoughts: I find
Would you proceed especially against Caius Marcius?
Would you not deem it breathed? and that those veins
Would you imagine, or almost believe,
Would you have been so brief with him, he would
Would you enforce me to a world of care?
Would without lapsing suffer: nay, sometimes,
Would use his heaven for thunder;
Would thus have wrought you,--for the stone is mine--
Would through the airy region stream so bright
Would think upon you for your voices and
Would they were basilisks, to strike thee dead!
Would they make peace? terrible hell make war
Would they else be content to die?
Would the nobility lay aside their ruth,
Would tempt unto a close exploit of death?
Would sing her song and dance her turn; now here,
Would she begin a sect, might quench the zeal
Would seem in me to affect speech and discourse;
Would seem but modest: therefore, I beseech you
Would say your head and butt were head and horn.
Would not this ill do well? Well, well, I see
Would not the beggar then forget himself?
Would not infect his reason?
Would not have touch'd, would not have stain'd with blood:
Would not have been so stern.
Would not entreat for life?
Would none but I might venge my cousin's death!
Would more have strengthen'd this our commonwealth
Would long ere this have met us on the way
Would it were mortal poison, for thy sake!
Would it not shame thee in so fair a troop
Would he were wasted, marrow, bones and all,
Would he were here, my lord! for he indeed
Would he not stumble? would he not fall down,
Would he do so, I'ld beg your precious mistress,
Would have shed water out of fire ere done't:
Would have him wed again.
Would hang themselves. Physic for't there is none;
Would feed on one another? What's their seeking?
Would fain have come with me to meet your grace,
Would buy this for a lie!
Would bring white hairs unto a quiet grave.
Would blow you through and through.
Would be your country's pleader, your good tongue,
Would be unparallel'd.
Would be her lord? or shall I say, her uncle?
Would be find up, my brother, with our thanks;
Would bark your honour from that trunk you bear,
Would all were well! but that will never be
Would all themselves laugh mortal.
Would all the world but he had quite forsworn!
Would Katharina had never seen him though!
Would I were sleep and peace, so sweet to rest!
Would I were dead, but that, methinks, already--
Would I were dead! if God's good will were so;
Would I not have; but nature should bring forth,
Would I might
Would I had been by, to have helped the old man!
Would I be guilty of so deep a sin.
Would I admit; no name of magistrate;
Would God that any in this noble presence
Wotting no more than I, are ignorant.
Worthy voices!
Worthy tribunes,
Worthy sir, thou bleed'st;
Worthy man!
Worthy his goodness. What might I have been,
Worthy enough a herdsman: yea, him too,
Worthy Sebastian? O, what might?--No more:--
Worthy Menenius Agrippa; one that hath always loved
Worthy Cominius, speak.
Worthy Camillo,
Worth six on him.
Worst in this royal presence may I speak,
Worse than tears drown: beseech you all, my lords,
Worse than a theft, no less than a traducement,
Worse than a promise-breaker.
Worse and worse; she will not come! O vile,
Work you then.
Words, life and all, old Lancaster hath spent.
Words against me? this is a good friar, belike!
Wooing poor craftsmen with the craft of smiles
Wondrous! ay, I warrant you, and not without his
Women! Help Heaven! men their creation mar
Women will love her, that she is a woman
Women may fall, when there's no strength in men.
Women are soft, mild, pitiful and flexible;
Women are made to bear, and so are you.
Women and children of so high a courage,
Woe, woe for England! not a whit for me;
Woe's scene, world's shame, grave's due by life usurp'd,
Woe to the land that's govern'd by a child!
Woe the while!
Woe me! for what?
Woe above woe! grief more than common grief!
Witty, courteous, liberal, full of spirit.
Witnessing storms to come, woe and unrest:
Witness the loving kiss I give the fruit.
Witness my son, now in the shade of death;
Without that title. Romeo, doff thy name,
Without sweat or endeavour: treason, felony,
Without suspicion.
Without ripe moving to't? Would I do this?
Without or grudge or grumblings: thou didst promise
Without more overture.
Without more mercy, to its own protection
Without his roe, like a dried herring: flesh, flesh,
Without her, follows to this land and me,
Without her love; for her employ them all;
Without control, listed to make his prey.
Without assistance.
Without a sudden calm, will overset
Without a parallel; those being all my study,
Without a burthen: time as long again
Within your house, to make mine eye the witness
Within whose circuit is Elysium
Within two hours.
Within thy help and holy physic lies:
Within three hours will fair Juliet wake:
Within this mile and half.
Within this hour my man shall be with thee
Within this hour bring me word 'tis done,
Within thine eyes sat twenty thousand deaths,
Within these three hours, Tullus,
Within their innocent alabaster arms:
Within the limits of yon lime and stone:
Within the infant rind of this small flower
Within the guilty closure of thy walls
Within the earth; and, therein laid,--there lies
Within rich Pisa walls, as any one
Within my mouth you have engaol'd my tongue,
Within my age. But reason with the fellow,
Within me grief hath kept a tedious fast;
Within Corioli gates: where he hath won,
Withhold revenge, dear God! 'tis not my fault,
Wither one rose, and let the other flourish;
Withdraw, my lord; I'll help you to a horse.
Withdraw yourselves.
Withdraw yourselves, and leave us here alone.
Withdraw you hence, my lord, I'll follow you.
Withdraw with us: and let the trumpets sound
Withdraw thee, wretched Margaret: who comes here?
Withal, what I have been, and what I am.
Withal obdurate, do not hear him plead;
Withal I did infer your lineaments,
With your crown'd brother and these your contracted
With worms that are thy chamber-maids; O, here
With words that made them known. But thy vile race,
With words of sooth! O that I were as great
With wisdom I might fear, my Doricles,
With wine and feeding, we have suppler souls
With whom the Kentishmen will willingly rise:
With whom my soul is any jot at odds
With whom an upright zeal to right prevails
With whom I am accused, I do confess
With whispering and most guilty diligence,
With what's unreal thou coactive art,
With what thou else call'st thine. If thou refuse
With what his valour did enrich his wit,
With what he would say, let him feel your sword,
With what encounter so uncurrent I
With what contempt he wore the humble weed,
With what a sharp-provided wit he reasons!
With wealth enough and young and beauteous,
With violent hefts. I have drunk,
With variable complexions, all agreeing
With us to break his neck.
With unrestrained loose companions,
With twenty hundred thousand times more joy
With trembling wings misdoubteth every bush;
With too much urging your pernicious lives,
With too much riches it confound itself:
With thy embracements to my wife's allies,
With thy black mantle; till strange love, grown bold,
With thousands of these quarter'd slaves, as high
With thoughts so qualified as your charities
With those that have but little: this must be patch'd
With those that I saw suffer: a brave vessel,
With those gross taunts I often have endured.
With this, we charged again: but, out, alas!
With this, my lord, myself have nought to do.
With this young prince.
With this night's revels and expire the term
With this my son, Prince Edward, Henry's heir,
With this dead-killing news!
With these forced thoughts, I prithee, darken not
With them, the two brave bears, Warwick and Montague,
With them he enters; who, upon the sudden,
With them forgive yourself.
With them Sir Thomas Vaughan, prisoners.
With their refusal, both observe and answer
With thee awhile: determine on some course,
With the sweet silent hours of marriage joys
With the least cause these his new honours, which
With the consent of supreme Jove, inform
With the attainder of his slanderous lips.
With that, methoughts, a legion of foul fiends
With that which, but by being so retired,
With that she's big with; for 'tis Polixenes
With that grim ferryman which poets write of,
With that dear blood which it hath fostered;
With tender Juliet match'd, is now not fair.
With tears drawn from her eyes by your foul wrongs.
With tears augmenting the fresh morning dew.
With tearful eyes add water to the sea
With such deep contempt made I him king for this?
With such austerity as 'longeth to a father.
With such a kind of love as might become
With stronger blood, we should have answer'd heaven
With striving less to be so; lesser had been
With stately triumphs, mirthful comic shows,
With spur we beat an acre. But to the goal:
With speedy help doth lend redress.'
With some men else, who think themselves as safe
With some few private friends upon this coast.
With some few bands of chosen soldiers,
With solemn reverence: throw away respect,
With soft low tongue and lowly courtesy,
With smiling plenty and fair prosperous days!
With slow but stately pace kept on his course,
With sleight and manhood stole to Rhesus' tents,
With six Aufidiuses, or more, his tribe,
With signs of war about his aged neck:
With shunless destiny; aidless came off,
With scruples and do set the word itself
With saints dost bait thy hook! Most dangerous
With rival-hating envy, set on you
With rigorous hands: he hath resisted law,
With reverend fathers and well-learned bishops.
With resolution, wheresoe'er I meet thee--
With repetition of my Romeo's name.
With reeky shanks and yellow chapless skulls;
With raven's feather from unwholesome fen
With ransom of such shame. Would yet he had lived!
With purple fountains issuing from your veins,
With purple falchion, painted to the hilt
With promise of his sister, and what else,
With promise of high pay and great rewards:
With profits of the mind, study and fast.
With precepts that would make invincible
With powerful policy strengthen themselves,
With politic grave counsel; then the king
With piercing steel at bold Mercutio's breast,
With pay and thanks, and let's away to London
With patience, noble lord, as prisoners must:
With painted imagery had said at once
With our own charge, making a treaty where
With other muniments and petty helps
With open outcry toward our monument.
With only suffering stain by him; for him
With one that wants her wits?
With one soft kiss a thousand furlongs ere
With one consent to have her so bestow'd;
With one 'We thank you' many thousands moe
With old odd ends stolen out of holy writ;
With old Menenius, and those senators
With oily painting. Shall I draw the curtain?
With oath kept waking and with brawling fed:
With nothing trembles: at some thing it grieves,
With nothing shall be pleased, till he be eased
With no less terror than the elements
With no less honour to the Antiates
With nimble soles: I have a soul of lead
With much ado at length have gotten leave
With more of thine: this love that thou hast shown
With modest warrant.
With mine own tongue deny my sacred state,
With mine own tears I wash away my balm,
With mine own hands I give away my crown,
With mine own breath release all duty's rites:
With many more confederates, are in arms.
With many heads butts me away. Nay, mother,
With manacles thorough our streets, or else
With maids to seem the lapwing and to jest,
With love's light wings did I o'er-perch these walls;
With lies well steel'd with weighty arguments;
With letters of your love to her at large.
With less respect than we do minister
With labour and the thing she took to quench it,
With its sweet air: thence I have follow'd it,
With instruments upon them, fit to open
With inky blots and rotten parchment bonds:
With humble and familiar courtesy,
With honours like himself.
With honour, as in war, since that to both
With his unkindness? say't be so?
With his mail'd hand then wiping, forth he goes,
With his good will and thy good company,
With her whom here I cannot hold on shore;
With her companion grief must end her life.
With heigh! with heigh! the thrush and the jay,
With heigh! the sweet birds, O, how they sing!
With heigh! the doxy over the dale,
With hearts more proof than shields. Advance,
With heads, and not with hands; those whom you curse
With hate in those where I expect most love!
With hasty Germans and blunt Hollanders,
With harsh resounding trumpets' dreadful bray,
With hard bright steel and hearts harder than steel.
With hair up-staring,--then like reeds, not hair,--
With grief that's beauty's canker, thou mightst call him
With great creating nature.
With good old folks and let them tell thee tales
With giving him glory.
With gentle conference, soft and affable.
With gentle breath, calm look, knees humbly bow'd,
With fury from his native residence.
With flowers of winter.
With flight and agued fear! Mend and charge home,
With fiery eyes sparkling for very wrath,
With fame, a name to Caius Marcius; these
With eyes wide open; standing, speaking, moving,
With every minute you do change a mind,
With eight tall ships, three thousand men of war,
With eager feeding food doth choke the feeder:
With dull unwilligness to repay a debt
With downright payment, show'd unto my father.
With divers deaths in death.
With daily prayers all to that effect.
With customary compliment; when he,
With curses in her mouth, tears in her eyes,
With cozening hope: he is a flatterer,
With colours fairer painted their foul ends.
With cloth of any colour.
With clog of conscience and sour melancholy
With child, perhaps?
With character too gross is writ on Juliet.
With cautelous baits and practise.
With bootless labour swim against the tide
With bloody passage led your wars even to
With blood removed but little from her own?
With best advantage will deceive the time,
With being nothing. Music do I hear?
With bats and clubs? The matter? speak, I pray you.
With baleful weeds and precious-juiced flowers.
With bag and baggage: many thousand on's
With as big heart as thou. Do as thou list
With any scruple; your scope is as mine own
With any but with us.
With an eye of green in't.
With an aspect more favourable. Good my lords,
With all your just proceedings in this cause.
With all their powerful friends, are fled to him.
With all the rest of that consorted crew,
With all the nearest things to my heart, as well
With all the honours on my brother: whereon,
With all the gracious utterance thou hast
With all the friends that thou, brave Earl of March,
With all the effect of love.
With all the applause and clamour of the host,
With all the admired beauties of Verona:
With all swift speed you must away to France.
With all prerogative: hence his ambition growing--
With all our harts.
With all my heart; and much it joys me too,
With all my heart. This fellow I remember,
With all my heart
With all his trim belonging; and from this time,
With all her double vigour, art and nature,
With all good speed at Plashy visit me.
With aid of soldiers to this needful war.
With age and altering rheums? can he speak? hear?
With accusations, as I hear, more strong
With a sweet fellow to't?
With a swain's wearing, and me, poor lowly maid,
With a proud heart he wore his humble weeds.
With a nuptial knot, if thou vouchsafe to grant
With a light heart; trust not my holy order,
With a foul traitor's name stuff I thy throat;
With Tybalt's slander,--Tybalt, that an hour
With Rosaline, my ghostly father? no;
With Romeo, till I behold him--dead--
With Rivers, Vaughan, Grey: and so 'twill do
With Lady Margery, your midwife there,
With Cupid's arrow; she hath Dian's wit;
With Clifford and the haught Northumberland,
With Cain go wander through shades of night,
With Angelo to-night shall lie
With 'Thanks, my countrymen, my loving friends;'
Wishing his foot were equal with his eye,
Wish we all joy and honour.
Wisely and slow; they stumble that run fast.
Wise! why, no question but he was.
Wipe off the dust that hides our sceptre's gilt
Wine, wine, wine! What service
Windy attorneys to their client woes,
Win upon power and throw forth greater themes
Wilt thou, O God, fly from such gentle lambs,
Wilt thou provoke me? then have at thee, boy!
Wilt thou not, Jule?' it stinted and said 'Ay.'
Wilt thou not, Jule?' and, by my holidame,
Wilt thou not hide the trespass of thine own?
Wilt thou have music? hark! Apollo plays,
Wilt thou conceal this dark conspiracy?
Wilt thou be made a man out of my vice?
Wilt thou be gone? it is not yet near day:
William Lord Hastings had pronounced your part,--
Will't please your mightiness to wash your hands?
Will't please your lordship drink a cup of sack?
Will't please your honour taste of these conserves?
Will't please you walk aside?
Will't not off?
Will you we show our title to the crown?
Will you undo yourselves?
Will you tell me that?
Will you take eggs for money?
Will you swear
Will you speak well of him that kill'd your cousin?
Will you permit that I shall stand condemn'd
Will you not push her out? Give her the bastard.
Will you go to them? I will bring you thither.
Will you go along with us?
Will you give thanks, sweet Kate; or else shall I?
Will you buy any tape,
Will you be ready? do you like this haste?
Will you be put in mind of his blind fortune,
Will you be gone?
Will wing me to some wither'd bough and there
Will well become the seat of majesty,
Will watch thy waking, and that very night
Will vouch the truth of it. Him I accuse
Will undertake to woo curst Katharina,
Will touch us all too near, if God prevent not.
Will to your mother, to entreat of her
Will thither straight, for willingness rids way;
Will they not hear? What, ho! you men, you beasts,
Will thereto be obedient, I have reason;
Will then cry out of Marcius 'O if he
Will the time serve to tell? I do not think.
Will the king come, that I may breathe my last
Will take again your queen as yours at first,
Will soon recover his accustom'd health.
Will so your accusation overweigh,
Will serve the turn.
Will scare the herd, and so my shoot is lost.
Will raise us all.
Will rain hot vengeance on offenders' heads.
Will prove too bloody, and the end of it
Will prove as bitter, black, and tragical.
Will piece up in himself.
Will or exceed the common or be caught
Will now deny to dance? she that makes dainty,
Will not you go?
Will not the mayor then and his brethren come?
Will not so graceless be to be ingrate.
Will not proclaim against her maiden loss,
Will not have earth to know.
Will not King Richard let me speak with him?
Will no more hear from thence.
Will never do him good, not one of you.
Will ne'er wear out the everlasting flint:
Will maintain it with some little cost.
Will keep a league till death. Hie thee to France
Will it not be?
Will issue out again and bid us battle:
Will hiss me to my grave: contempt and clamour
Will he woo her? ay, or I'll hang her.
Will he endure your sight as yet, I fear:
Will have your tongue too. This is a creature,
Will have fulfill'd their secret purposes;
Will guard your person while you take your rest,
Will greet us here anon, my gentle Varrius.
Will follow mine, if once they see them spread;
Will ever after droop. Here cease more questions:
Will deign to sip or touch one drop of it.
Will cry it o'er again: it is a hint
Will cost my crown, and like an empty eagle
Will come on very slowly. I am sorry,
Will clear or end the business: when the oracle,
Will but remember me what a deal of world
Will but amount to five and twenty thousand,
Will bring me to consider that which may
Will bear up with this exercise, so long
Will bear the knave by the volume. The honour'd gods
Will be my knell. Go, play, boy, play.
Will be as rash in the repeal, as hasty
Will apprehend you as his enemy.
Will answer in mine honour.
Will I withal endow a child of thine;
Will I set up my everlasting rest,
Will I make good against thee, arm to arm,
Will I live?
Will I lend ear to. Ha! what shout is this?
Will I apply that treats of happiness
Wife, mother, child, I know not. My affairs
Wife, love Lord Hastings, let him kiss your hand;
Wife, go you to her ere you go to bed;
Wife to thy Edward, to thy slaughter'd son,

Widow, go you along. Lords, use her honourably.

Why, therefore fire; for I have caught extreme cold.

Why, there thou hast it: two deep enemies,
Why, then, thy husband's lands I freely give thee.
Why, then, though loath, yet must I be content:
Why, then, the champions are prepared, and stay
Why, then, let's on our way in silent sort:
Why, then, give way, dull clouds, to my quick curses!
Why, then, O brawling love! O loving hate!
Why, then, I will. Farewell, old Gaunt.
Why, then, I do but dream on sovereignty;
Why, then you should discover a brace of unmeriting,
Why, then you mean not as I thought you did.
Why, then we shall have a stirring world again.
Why, then thou shalt not have thy husband's lands.
Why, then thou canst not break her to the lute?
Why, then thou art an executioner.
Why, then they are not dead:
Why, then the world and all that's in't is nothing;
Why, then the maid is mine from all the world,
Why, then resolve me whether you will or no.
Why, then mine honesty shall be my dower;
Why, then let's home again. Come, sirrah, let's away.
Why, then is my pump well flowered.
Why, then he will say we stabbed him sleeping.
Why, then he is alive.
Why, then comes in the sweet o' the year;
Why, then I would not fly. Ah, Montague,
Why, then I will do what your grace commands.
Why, then All-Souls' day is my body's doomsday.

Why ask I that? my mangled body shows,

Why I descend into this bed of death,

Why
Whose youthful spirit, in me regenerate,
Whose wisdom was a mirror to the wisest;
Whose western side is with a vineyard back'd;
Whose warlike ears could never brook retreat,
Whose unavoided eye is murderous.
Whose ugly and unnatural aspect
Whose top-branch overpeer'd Jove's spreading tree
Whose tongue?
Whose tongue more poisons than the adder's tooth!
Whose sudden sight hath thrall'd my wounded eye.
Whose sting is sharper than the sword's;
Whose state and honour I for aye allow.
Whose soul is that which takes her heavy leave?
Whose settled visage and deliberate word
Whose salt imagination yet hath wrong'd
Whose sale is present death in Mantua,
Whose rocky shore beats back the envious siege
Whose repetition will be dogg'd with curses;
Whose passions and whose plots have broke their sleep,
Whose names are written there, and to them say,
Whose manners still our tardy apish nation
Whose ignorant credulity will not
Whose humble means match not his haughty mind:
Whose house?
Whose house, whose bed, whose meal, and exercise,
Whose honour and whose honesty till now
Whose hollow womb inherits nought but bones.
Whose heir my father was, and I am his.
Whose haughty spirit, winged with desire,
Whose hand soever lanced their tender hearts,
Whose hand is that the forest bear doth lick?
Whose frown hath made thee faint and fly ere this!
Whose fresh complexion and whose heart together
Whose father slew my father, he shall die.
Whose father for his hoarding went to hell?
Whose father bears the title of a king,--
Whose envious gulf did swallow up his life.
Whose enmity he flung aside, and breasted
Whose duty is deceiveable and false.
Whose double tongue may with a mortal touch
Whose double bosoms seem to wear one heart,
Whose deadly web ensnareth thee about?
Whose credit with the judge, or own great place,
Whose compass is no bigger than thy head;
Whose chronicle thus writ: 'The man was noble,
Whose children he hath slain, their base throats tear
Whose bright out-shining beams thy cloudy wrath
Whose arms gave shelter to the princely eagle,
Whoop'd out of Rome. Now this extremity
Whom you have banish'd, does exceed you all.
Whom with all praise I point at, saw him fight,
Whom with a crack'd heart I have sent to Rome,
Whom we have left protectors of the king,
Whom thou wert sworn to cherish and defend.
Whom thou obeyed'st thirty and six years,
Whom thou lovest best: see thou dissemble not.
Whom stripes may move, not kindness! I have used thee,
Whom son I dare not call; thou art too base
Whom should he follow but his natural king?
Whom now I keep in service. Thou best know'st
Whom late you have named for consul.
Whom it concerns to hear this matter forth,
Whom in this conflict I unwares have kill'd.
Whom he begot with child, let her appear,
Whom for this time we pardon. We enjoin thee,
Whom fair befal in heaven 'mongst happy souls!
Whom envy hath immured within your walls!
Whom conscience and my kindred bids to right.
Whom I would save, had a most noble father!
Whom I will marry straight to Clarence' daughter:
Whom I unnaturally shall disinherit.
Whom I proclaim a man of truth, of mercy;
Whom I left cooling of the air with sighs
Whom I encounter'd as the battles join'd.
Whom I employ'd was pre-employ'd by him:
Whom I believe to be most strait in virtue,
Whom God preserve better than you would wish!--
Whom God hath join'd together; ay, and 'twere pity
Whoever got thee, there thy mother stands;
Whoever gave that counsel, to give forth

Who told me, when we both lay in the field

Who told me how the poor soul did forsake
Who thunders to his captives blood and death,
Who thrives and who declines; side factions
Who thinks he knows that he ne'er knew my body,
Who they shall be that straight shall post to Ludlow.
Who taught you this?
Who sues to thee and cries 'God save the queen'?
Who sued to me for him? who, in my rage,
Who strongly hath set footing in this land:
Who spake of brotherhood? who spake of love?
Who slew to-day a righteous gentleman
Who sitting in the stocks refuge their shame,
Who should that be? belike, unlook'd-for friends.
Who should succeed the father but the son?
Who should have died when Claudio lost his head;
Who shall reward you better for my life
Who shall hinder me?
Who shall begin?
Who shall ask it?
Who sets me else? by heaven, I'll throw at all:
Who set this ancient quarrel new abroach?
Who sent you hither? Wherefore do you come?
Who sensibly outdares his senseless sword,
Who saw the sun to-day?
Who prays continually for Richmond's good:
Who please to come and hear. For life, I prize it
Who pass'd, methought, the melancholy flood,
Who now the price of his dear blood doth owe?
Who now are here, taking their leaves of me,
Who nothing hurt withal hiss'd him in scorn:
Who not contented that he lopp'd the branch

Who may, in the ambush of my name, strike home,
Who makest a show but darest not strike, thy conscience
Who made thee, then, a bloody minister,
Who made the Dauphin and the French to stoop
Who loves another best.
Who look'd full gently on his warlike queen,
Who lets it hop a little from her hand,
Who least will seem to do so, my past life
Who lack not virtue, no, nor power, but that
Who knows the lord protector's mind herein?
Who knows not where a wasp does
Who knows not that?
Who knows not that the noble duke is dead?
Who knows not he is dead! who knows he is?
Who knocks so hard? whence come you? what's your will?
Who knew of Your intent and coming hither?
Who is't that goes with me? Beseech your highness,
Who is't that calls? is it my lady mother?
Who is the sink o' the body,--
Who is that calls so coldly?
Who is so far from Italy removed
Who is of Rome worse hated than of you,
Who is most inward with the royal duke?
Who is lost too: take your patience to you,
Who is it?
Who is it that hath died for this offence?
Who is as free from touch or soil with her
Who is already sick and pale with grief,
Who intercepts my expedition?
Who in this kind of merry fooling am nothing
Who in rebellion with himself will have
Who hither come engaged by my oath--
Who here hath lain these two days buried.
Who having pinch'd a few and made them cry,
Who having into truth, by telling of it,
Who have we here?
Who hath not seen them, even with those wings
Who hath descried the number of the foe?
Who hath committed them?
Who hath cause to wet the grief on't.
Who hath a story ready for your ear.
Who hast the memory of Hermione,
Who has a charter to extol her blood,
Who hadst deserved more than a prison.
Who had, no doubt, some noble creature in her,
Who had but newly entertain'd revenge,
Who goes there?
Who gently would dissolve the bands of life,
Who gave his blood to lime the stones together,
Who from my cabin tempted me to walk
Who for this seven years hath esteem'd him
Who for Bohemia bend, to signify
Who ever would have thought it? Romeo!
Who even in pure and vestal modesty,
Who does infect her?
Who do prepare to meet him at the gates,
Who did hoot him out o' the city.
Who deserves greatness
Who crown'd the gracious duke in high despite,
Who cried aloud, 'What scourge for perjury
Who comes with him?
Who can do good on him?
Who can be patient in such extremes?
Who calls so loud?
Who by his prowess conquered all France:
Who but to-day hammer'd of this design,
Who builds his hopes in air of your good looks,
Who brought it?
Who bow'd but in my stirrup, bend like his
Who bare my letter, then, to Romeo?
Who are they that complain unto the king,
Who answer'd him, they came from Buckingham.
Who am prepared against your territories,
Who all this while hath revell'd in the night
Who all as hot, turns deadly point to point,
Who I do think is mine and love as mine,
Who 'scapes the lurking serpent's mortal sting?

Whither?
Whither?
Whither?
Whither, if it please you, we may now withdraw us.
Whither you will, so I were from your sights.
Whither wilt thou go? Take good Cominius
Whither the queen intends. Forward; away!
Whither away, or where is thy abode?
Whither 'tis bent: most likely 'tis for you:
Whiter than new snow on a raven's back.
White-liver'd runagate, what doth he there?
White-beards have arm'd their thin and hairless scalps
Whisper the spirits of thine enemies
Whipt first, sir, and hanged after.
Whipp'd and tormented and--God-den, good fellow.
Whip me? No, no; let carman whip his jade:
Whilst, with no softer cushion than the flint,
Whilst, in the mildness of your sleepy thoughts,
Whilst you have fed upon my signories,
Whilst we were wandering with the antipodes,
Whilst thou liest warm at home, secure and safe;
Whilst that my wretchedness doth bait myself,
Whilst others come to make him lose at home:
Whilst my invention, hearing not my tongue,
Whilst my gross flesh sinks downward, here to die.
Whilst he, from the one side to the other turning,
Whilst all tongues cried 'God save thee,
Whilst I, with those that have the spirit, will haste
Whilst I remember
Whilst I propose the selfsame words to thee,
Whilst I awhile obsequiously lament
Whilst Dighton thus told on: 'We smothered
Whilst Bolingbroke, through our security,
Whiles, in his moan, the ship splits on the rock,
Whiles thou art waking.
Whiles other men have gates and those gates open'd,
Whiles lions war and battle for their dens,
Whiles he was hastening, in the chase, it seems,
Whiles Warwick tells his title, smooths the wrong,
While you, sweet dear, prove mistress of my heart!
While you are thus employ'd, what resteth more,
While we were interchanging thrusts and blows,
While we return these dukes what we decree.
While we pursued the horsemen of the north,
While we lie tumbling in the hay.
While we devise fell tortures for thy faults.
While we bethink a means to break it off.
While she did call me rascal fiddler
While she chats him: the kitchen malkin pins
While proud ambitious Edward Duke of York
While kites and buzzards prey at liberty.
While he himself keeps in the cold field?
While he enjoys the honour and his ease.
While he did bear my countenance in the town;
While counterfeit supposes bleared thine eyne.
While I with self-same kindness welcome thine.
While I use further conference with Warwick.
While I stand fooling here, his Jack o' the clock.
While I remain above the ground, you shall
While I myself will lead a private life
While I make way from hence to save my life:
Which, without note, here's many else have done,--
Which, whiles it lasted, gave King Henry light.
Which, well thou know'st, is cross, and full of sin.
Which, too much minded by herself alone,
Which, to the spire and top of praises vouch'd,
Which, till my infant fortune comes to years,
Which, though thou wouldst deny, denies thee vantage.
Which, since, succeeding ages have re-edified.
Which, of he or Adrian, for a good
Which, mellow'd by the stealing hours of time,
Which, look'd on as it is, is nought but shadows
Which, like unruly children, make their sire
Which, like a usurer, abound'st in all,
Which, in the day of battle, tire thee more
Which, by the sign thereof was termed so.
Which, by the heavens' assistance and your strength,
Which, being suffer'd, rivers cannot quench.
Which, being advanced, declines, and then men die.
Which, at more leisure, I will so excuse
Which, as thou know'st, unjustly must be spilt.
Which, as he breathed defiance to my ears,
Which, I protest, hath very much beguiled
Which, I presume, he'll take in gentle part.
Which, I dare vouch, is more than that he hath,
Which you, mistaking, offer up to joy.
Which you weep for.
Which you say adds to nature, is an art
Which you knew great, and to the hazard
Which you have not redeem'd; indeed, paid down
Which you do live upon; and fit it is,
Which you deny already: yet we will ask;
Which you are out of, with a gentler spirit,
Which yet seem shut, we, have but pinn'd with rushes;
Which would increase his evil. He that depends
Which would be so much the more dangerous
Which woo'd the slimy bottom of the deep,
Which with usurping steps do trample thee:
Which with sweet water nightly I will dew,
Which with such gentle sorrow he shook off,
Which with her dowry shall be counterpoised.
Which with a bounteous hand was kindly lent;
Which will not prove a whip: as many coxcombs
Which when I saw, I reprehended them;
Which were inshell'd when Marcius stood for Rome,
Which well appeared in his lineaments,
Which well I am assured I have not done,
Which we will second. When he lies along,
Which we ourselves have plough'd for, sow'd,
Which we more hunt for than the grace of God!
Which we in justice cannot well deny,
Which we have noted in you to your kin,
Which we have goaded onward.
Which we disdain should tatter us, yet sought
Which we devise him.
Which way to be prevented, if to be;
Which way thou travellest: if along with us,
Which way ran he that kill'd Mercutio?
Which waste of idle hours hath quite thrown down.
Which was, that he, in lieu o' the premises
Which was your shame, by this unholy braggart,
Which was sometime his general; who loved him
Which was as gross as ever touch'd conjecture,
Which waits upon worn times hath something seized
Which traitor, thou wouldst have me answer to.
Which too untimely here did scorn the earth.
Which told me they had beat you to your trenches?
Which to this hour bewail the injury,
Which to the high top-gallant of my joy
Which to recure, we heartily solicit
Which to preserve is sleep, which being spotted
Which to maintain I would allow him odds,
Which to deny concerns more than avails; for as
Which tired majesty did make thee offer,
Which thou wilt propagate, to have it prest
Which thou takest from me. When thou camest first,
Which thou supposest I have done to thee.
Which thou shouldst bear me: only that name remains;
Which thou shalt thereby reap is such a name,
Which thou heard'st cry, which thou saw'st sink. Sit down;
Which thou forget'st. This damn'd witch Sycorax,
Which this man's life did owe you, you'll rejoice
Which they upon the adverse party want.
Which they have often made against the senate,
Which they have given to beggars.
Which then will speak, that you must
Which then our leisure would not let us hear,
Which then blew bitterly against our faces,
Which the rather
Which the dark night hath so discovered.
Which the commission of thy years and art
Which the air beats for vain. O place, O form,
Which ten times faster glide than the sun's beams,
Which stretched to their servants, daughters, wives,
Which sounded like a clamour in a vault,
Which sorrow is always towards ourselves, not heaven,
Which sometime they have used with fearful flight,
Which some call nature's bastards: of that kind
Which so roused up with boisterous untuned drums,
Which so long sunder'd friends should dwell upon:
Which sixteen winters cannot blow away,
Which since we cannot do to make you friends,
Which since have steaded much; so, of his gentleness,
Which shows me mine changed too; for I must be
Which shows like grief itself, but is not so;
Which should undo more doing: ay, and thou,
Which should bedeck thy shape, thy love, thy wit:
Which she shall purchase with still lasting war.
Which she hath praised him with above compare
Which serves it in the office of a wall,
Which serves as paste and cover to our bones.
Which seems a little fouler than it is,
Which seem to move and wanton with her breath,
Which runs himself and catches for his master.
Which robs my tongue from breathing native breath?
Which renders good for bad, blessings for curses.
Which quired with my drum, into a pipe
Which puts some of us in distemper, but
Which out of daily fortune ever taints
Which our profane hours here have stricken down.
Which our divines lose by 'em.
Which otherwise would grow into extremes.
Which once,' quoth Forrest, 'almost changed my mind;
Which once untangled, much misfortune bodes:
Which once thou sworest was worth the looking on;
Which once perform'd, let all the world say no,
Which on thy royal party granted once,
Which on my faith deserves high speech, and straight
Which on more view, of many mine being one
Which often, thus, correcting thy stout heart,
Which often hath no less prevail'd than so
Which oft the angry Mab with blisters plagues,
Which oft infects the wisest: these, my lord,
Which of you, if you were a prince's son,
Which of you trembles not that looks on me?
Which now, two tender playfellows to dust,
Which now's upon's; without the which this story
Which now the loving haste of these our friends,
Which now the house of Lancaster usurps,
Which now mistrust no parcel of my fear,
Which now came from him.
Which now bear evidence against my soul,
Which not to have done I think had been in me
Which not to cut would show thee but a fool,
Which never were nor no man ever saw.
Which never tender lady hath born greater,
Which never dreamt on aught but butcheries:
Which ne'er came from the lungs, but even thus--
Which ne'er I did remember: to my knowledge,
Which must be even as swiftly follow'd as
Which most gibingly, ungravely, he did fashion
Which modern lamentations might have moved?
Which men are best inclined.
Which may, if fortune please, both breed thee, pretty,
Which mannerly devotion shows in this;
Which makes thee thus presumptuous and proud,
Which makes the silver rivers drown their shores,
Which makes me sweat with wrath. Come on, my fellows:
Which made the fault that we cannot correct,
Which live like venom where no venom else
Which lets go by some sixteen years and makes her
Which issued from my other angel husband
Which is the wiser here? Justice or Iniquity? Is
Which is the least?
Which is the god of my idolatry,
Which is the bell: so sighs and tears and groans
Which is that Barnardine?
Which is not yet perform'd me.
Which is his house, beseech you?
Which is from my remembrance! Please you, farther.
Which is for me less easy to commit
Which is as thin of substance as the air
Which industry and courage might have saved?
Which in your outward actions shows itself
Which in their summer beauty kiss'd each other.
Which in the time of death he gave our father.
Which in the soldier is flat blasphemy.
Which in myself I boldly will defend;
Which in his greatest need will shrink from him.
Which in a set hand fairly is engross'd,
Which in a napkin being close convey'd
Which if thou please to hide in this true bosom.
Which if they do, yet will I keep thee safe,
Which hoxes honesty behind, restraining
Which honour does acknowledge, whereof the least
Which honour and allegiance cannot think.
Which his triumphant father's hand had won;
Which his hell-govern'd arm hath butchered!
Which his aspiring rider seem'd to know,
Which here you urge to prove us enemies,
Which here you come to accuse.
Which here we waken to our country's good,
Which held three dearly as his soul's redemption,
Which heavy sorrow makes them apt unto:
Which he, young wanton and effeminate boy,
Which he was lord of; or whether nature,
Which he treads on at noon: but I do wonder
Which he so sets at nought.
Which he not dreams of.
Which he has put upon't!
Which he did end all his; and took some pride
Which he counts but a trifle.
Which he corrects, then were he tyrannous;
Which have, like unscour'd armour, hung by the wall
Which have for long run by the hideous law,
Which haply by much company might be urged:
Which had you rather, that the most just law
Which grieves me when I see my shame in him.
Which gently laid my knighthood on my shoulder,
Which from the vineyard to the garden leads;
Which for this nineteen years we have let slip;
Which for things true weeps things imaginary.
Which for some reasons, sir, I mean to see.
Which for some reasons I would not have seen.
Which fondly you would here impose on me;
Which first was mine own king: and here you sty me
Which finds it an inforced pilgrimage.
Which fear, not reverence, makes thee to except.
Which false hope lingers in extremity.
Which ever since hath kept my eyes from rest;
Which end o' the beam should bow. We have lost your
Which else would put you to your fortune and
Which else would post until it had return'd
Which elder days shall ripen and confirm
Which easily endures not article
Which draught to me were cordial.
Which done, God take King Edward to his mercy,
Which does mend nature, change it rather, but
Which didst unworthy slaughter upon others.
Which did subdue the greatest part of Spain;
Which dances with your daughter?
Which craves as desperate an execution.
Which contradicts my accusation and
Which comes to me in name of fault, I must not
Which cannot brook the accent of reproof.
Which can make gods forsworn? I melt, and am not
Which by the interpretation of full time
Which by my presence might have been concluded.
Which by his death hath lost much majesty.
Which breathed this poison.
Which blood, like sacrificing Abel's, cries,
Which being so horrible, so bloody, must
Which being shallow, you give me leave
Which bars a thousand harms and lengthens life.
Which as they kiss consume: the sweetest honey
Which art possess'd now to depose thyself.
Which art a lion and a king of beasts?
Which argued thee a most unloving father.
Which are the children of an idle brain,
Which are so weak of courage and in judgment
Which are as easy broke as they make forms.
Which any print of goodness wilt not take,
Which almost burst to belch it in the sea.
Which after hours give leisure to repent.
Which a dismiss'd offence would after gall;
Which I'll not call a creature of thy place,
Which I'll lay down.
Which I would free, if I shall be condemn'd
Which I with some unwillingness pronounce:
Which I will purchase with my duteous service;
Which I protest against--I am assisted
Which I have sworn to weed and pluck away.
Which I have better'd rather than decreased:
Which I do last pronounce, is, O you wonder!
Which I dispersed, they all have met again
Which I did think with slower foot came on,
Which I could fancy more than any other.
Which I can scarcely bear.
Which He hath given for fence impregnable,
Which God revenge!
Which God defend that I should wring from him!
Which God defend a knight should violate!--
Which 'tis not fit you know, I not acquaint
Whether you had not sometime in your life
Whether to knock against the gates of Rome,
Whether the tyranny be in his place,
Whether our kinsman come to see his friends.
Whether it like me or no, I am a courtier. Seest
Whether it be the fault and glimpse of newness,
Whether for east or west: the dearth is great;
Whether I blush or no: howbeit, I thank you.
Wherewith I reign'd? I hardly yet have learn'd
Whereto, when they shall know what men are rich,
Whereto we are bound? alack, or we must lose
Whereto we are bound, together with thy victory,
Whereto thy tongue a party-verdict gave:
Whereto my finger, like a dial's point,
Whereto if you'll a willing ear incline,
Whereto I have invited many a guest,
Whereof we have ta'en good and good store, of all
Whereof the root was fix'd in virtue's ground,
Whereof the king my brother stood possess'd.
Whereof our uncle Gaunt did stand possess'd.
Whereof I shall not have intelligence.
Whereof I know she is not ignorant:
Wherein--let no man hear me--I take pride,
Wherein, my friends, have I offended you?
Wherein your lady and your humble wife
Wherein your cunning can assist me much.
Wherein you see me smear'd; if any fear
Wherein thyself shalt highly be employ'd.
Wherein thy counsel and consent is wanting.
Wherein thou seest me mask'd; for thy revenge
Wherein thou liest in reputation sick;
Wherein this trunk was framed, and in her hand
Wherein the king stands generally condemn'd.
Wherein the acorn cradled. Follow.
Wherein our entertainment shall shame us we will be
Wherein my grandsire and my father sat?
Wherein I seem unnatural: desire not
Wherefore? wherefore?
Wherefore, gentle maiden,
Wherefore that box?

Where's Caius Marcius?
Where's Bohemia? speak.
Where'er it be, in heaven or in earth.
Where'er I wander, boast of this I can,
Where youth, and cost, and witless bravery keeps.
Where your brave father breathed his latest gasp,
Where you'll be loath to be: besides you know
Where you were tied in duty, and as sorry
Where you shall find me well accompanied
Where you shall be an everlasting leiger:
Where you may have such vantage on the duke,
Where words are scarce, they are seldom spent in vain,
Where will doth mutiny with wit's regard.
Where were you born, friend?
Where were her life? she durst not call me so,
Where we're offenders now, appear soul-vex'd,
Where we were lodgers at the Pegasus.
Where thou shalt rest, that thou mayst hear of us
Where thou shalt live, till we can find a time
Where they shall know our mind: away!
Where then, alas, may I complain myself?
Where the warlike Smalus,
Where the infectious pestilence did reign,
Where the disease is violent. Lay hands upon him,
Where the devil should this Romeo be?
Where that same banish'd runagate doth live,
Where small experience grows. But in a few,
Where slept our scouts, or how are they seduced,
Where sits deformity to mock my body;
Where should this music be? i' the air or the earth?
Where should she be? How oddly thou repliest!
Where should be graven, if that right were right,
Where shivering cold and sickness pines the clime;
Where she at least is banish'd from your eye,
Where shame doth harbour, even in Mowbray's face.
Where shall we sojourn till our coronation?
Where shall we dine? O me! What fray was here?
Where serpents are; chain me with roaring bears;
Where senators shall mingle tears with smiles,
Where rude misgovern'd hands from windows' tops
Where peremptory Warwick now remains:
Where our right valiant father is become.
Where one part does disdain with cause, the other
Where one on his side fights, thousands will fly.
Where on a sudden one hath wounded me,
Where of the execution did cry out
Where nothing lives but crosses, cares and grief.
Where nothing can proceed that toucheth us
Where no priest shovels in dust. O cursed wretch,
Where no man never comes but that sad dog
Where my poor young was limed, was caught and kill'd.
Where lies he?
Where left we last?
Where kings command. I was, I must confess,
Where it was forged, with my rapier's point.
Where it seems best unto your royal self.
Where it perceives it is but faintly borne.
Where it fits not you to know.
Where it did mark, it took; from face to foot

Where is he?

Where is Lord Stanley quarter'd, dost thou know?
Where in that nest of spicery they shall breed
Where he was to begin and give away
Where he should find you lions, finds you hares;
Where he shall answer, by a lawful form,
Where he abides.
Where having nothing, nothing can he lose.
Where have you lurk'd, that you make doubt of it?
Where have I been! Nay, how now! where are you?
Where hast thou been preserved? where lived? how found
Where great patricians shall attend and shrug,
Where great Aufidius lies: is he in Antium?
Where foxes, geese: you are no surer, no,
Where fearing dying pays death servile breath.
Where eyes did once inhabit, there were crept,
Where every horse bears his commanding rein,
Where ever Englishman durst set his foot.
Where dwellest thou?
Where doth the world thrust forth a vanity--
Where did you study all this goodly speech?
Where did you dwell when I was King of England?
Where did I leave?
Where chance may nurse or end it. Take it up.
Where bloody Tybalt, yet but green in earth,
Where be these knaves? What, no man at door
Where be these enemies? Capulet! Montague!
Where be the thronging troops that follow'd thee?
Where be the bending peers that flatter'd thee?
Where art thou, keeper? give me a cup of wine.
Where are your mess of sons to back you now?
Where are thy tenants and thy followers?
Where are thy children? wherein dost thou, joy?
Where are those--Sit down, Kate, and welcome.--
Where are the vile beginners of this fray?
Where are the evidence that do accuse me?
Where are my slippers? Shall I have some water?
Where and what time your majesty shall please.
Where and what time thou wilt perform the rite;
Where all the kindred of the Capulets lie.
Where all my sins are writ, and that's myself.
Where Juliet lives; and every cat and dog
Where I shall kneel to him that slew my father!
Where I must take like seat unto my fortune,
Where I may read who pass'd that passing fair?
Where I have seen corruption boil and bubble
Where I have learn'd me to repent the sin
Where I arrive, and my approach be shunn'd,
Where Claudio stoop'd to death, and with like haste.
Where 'tis predominant; and 'tis powerful, think it,
Whensoever he's convented. First, for this woman.

When you shall come to clearer knowledge, that
When you have vow'd, you must not speak with men

When you depart from him, but, soft and low,
When you curse them as enemies.
When you cast out, it still came home.
When you are gentle, you shall have one too,
When you are cloudy.

When will he be here?
When what's not meet, but what must be, was law,
When well-apparell'd April on the heel
When weeping made you break the story off,
When we were chosen tribunes for the people,--
When we shall hap to give 't them.
When we grow stronger, then we'll make our claim:
When triumph is become an alehouse guest?
When time shall call him home from banishment,
When time is broke and no proportion kept!
When thou wert king; who, travelling towards York,
When thou mayst tell thy tale a nearer way?
When thou hast broke it in so dear degree?
When thou didst crown his warlike brows with paper
When thou didst bower the spirit of a fiend
When thou comest thither--
When this is known, then to divide the times:
When they should serve their sovereign in the west?
When they do homage to this simple peasant.
When they are gone, then must I count my gains.
When they are bound to serve, love and obey.
When theirs are dry, for Romeo's banishment.
When the tongue's office should be prodigal
When the sun sets, who doth not look for night?
When the sun sets, the air doth drizzle dew;
When the sea is. Hence! What cares these roarers
When the devout religion of mine eye
When the alarum were struck than idly sit
When such bad dealings must be seen in thought.
When such a sacred king should hide his head.
When steel grows soft as the parasite's silk,
When she, poor hen, fond of no second brood,
When she will take the rein I let her run;
When she will play with reason and discourse,
When she was young you woo'd her; now in age
When she does praise me grieves me. I have done
When she did suckle Hector, look'd not lovelier
When scarce the blood was well wash'd from his hands
When presently through all thy veins shall run
When our sea-walled garden, the whole land,
When one but of my ordinance stood up
When once she is my wife.
When nights are longest there: I'll take my leave.
When nature brought him to the door of death?
When my poor heart no measure keeps in grief:
When my good falcon made her flight across
When must he die?
When most the truth; which I receive much better
When most struck home, being gentle wounded, craves
When men were fond, I smiled and wonder'd how.
When men are unprepared and look not for it.
When judges steal themselves. What, do I love her,
When it was less expected: he replied,
When it lies starkly in the traveller's bones:
When it is least expected.
When it is baked with frost.
When it hoars ere it be spent.
When it doth tax itself; as these black masks
When it did taste the wormwood on the nipple
When it deserves, with characters of brass,
When holy and devout religious men
When holy Harry died, and my sweet son.
When he would force it? Sure, it is no sin,
When he wakes! why, fool, he shall never wake till
When he stands where I am and sees you there.
When he shall split thy very heart with sorrow,
When he shall miss me,--as, in faith, I mean not
When he perceives the envious clouds are bent
When he might spurn him with his foot away?
When he might act the woman in the scene,
When he hath power to crush? Why, had your bodies
When he had done, some followers of mine own,
When he had carried Rome and that we look'd
When he doth bid good morrow with such a spirit.
When he did stand for consul, which he lost
When he did need your loves, and do you think
When he bestrides the lazy-pacing clouds
When have I injured thee? when done thee wrong?
When great leaves fall, the winter is at hand;
When good manners shall lie all in one or two men's
When gallant-springing brave Plantagenet,
When first I did embrace him: yet his nature
When evil deeds have their permissive pass
When every grief is entertain'd that's offer'd,
When dying clouds contend with growing light,
When didst thou sleep when such a deed was done?
When did she cross thee with a bitter word?
When daffodils begin to peer,
When corn was given them gratis, you repined;
When clouds appear, wise men put on their cloaks;
When care, mistrust, and treason waits on him.
When but love's shadows are so rich in joy!
When blows have made me stay, I fled from words.
When black-faced Clifford shook his sword at him;
When as the noble Duke of York was slain,
When as the enemy hath been ten to one:
When Tarquin made a head for Rome, he fought
When Richmond was a little peevish boy.
When Oxford had me down, he rescued me,
When King Cophetua loved the beggar-maid!
When I, thy three-hours wife, have mangled it?
When I, that censure him, do so offend,
When I'll depose I had him in mine arms
When I would pray and think, I think and pray
When I wore it at your daughter's marriage?
When I was last in Holborn,
When I was crown'd I was but nine months old.
When I should mount with wings of victory:
When I should bid good morrow to my bride,
When I shall see this gentleman, thy speeches
When I shall gust it last. How came't, Camillo,
When I shall ask the banns and when be married.
When I said, banish him, I said 'twas pity.
When I return with victory from the field
When I perceive your grace, like power divine,
When I have said, cry 'woe!' the queen, the queen,
When I have most need to employ a friend,
When I have heard your king's desert recounted,
When I have fought with Pembroke and his fellows,
When I have deck'd the sea with drops full salt,
When I do see the very book indeed
When I arrived and heard thee, that made gape
When I am cold in zeal to yours.
When I am alone, why, then I am Tranio;
When Clifford cannot spare his friends an oath.
When Bolingbroke rode on roan Barbary,
When Biondello comes, he waits on thee;
Whatever fortune stays him from his word:
Whatever I shall happen to devise.

Whate'er it bodes, henceforward will I bear

We do debase ourselves, cousin, do we not,
We do condemn thee to the very block
We did observe. Cousin Aumerle,
We did believe no less.
We could at once put us in readiness,
We come to use our hands and not our tongues.
We charge you, that you have contrived to take
We charge you, in God's name, and the king's,
We cannot, sir, we are undone already.
We cannot without circumstance descry.
We cannot weigh our brother with ourself:
We cannot miss him: he does make our fire,
We cannot keep the town.
We cannot be here and there too. Cheerly, boys; be
We can: my royal liege,
We can both sing it: if thou'lt bear a part, thou
We call a nettle but a nettle and
We bodged again; as I have seen a swan
We be affied and such assurance ta'en
We are, my lord; and come to have the warrant
We are yours i' the garden: shall's attend you there?
We are undone, lady, we are undone!
We are true subjects to the king, King Edward.
We are tougher, brother,
We are to speak in public; for this business
We are to reap the harvest of his son.
We are the queen's abjects, and must obey.
We are the greater poll, and in true fear
We are not, sir, nor are we like to be;
We are not safe, Clarence; we are not safe.
We are not furnish'd like Bohemia's son,
We are merely cheated of our lives by drunkards:
We are lucky, boy; and to be so still requires
We are less afraid to be drowned than thou art.
We are inforced to farm our royal realm;
We are fit to bid her welcome.
We are convented
We are but plain fellows, sir.
We are blest in this man, as I may say, even blest.
We are amazed; and thus long have we stood
We are all undone, unless
We are all frail.
We are advertised by our loving friends
We are accounted poor citizens, the patricians good.
We all have strongly sworn to give him aid;
Wave thus, to express his disposition,
Water with berries in't, and teach me how
Watching breeds leanness, leanness is all gaunt:
Watch'd for your voices; for Your voices bear
Wast born to bear? I was not made a horse;
Wash they his wounds with tears: mine shall be spent,
Wash my fierce hand in's heart. Go you to the city;
Was't you that revell'd in our parliament,
Was wont to cheer his dad in mutinies?
Was woe enough, if it had ended there:
Was to send him; for whose old love I have,
Was timed with dying cries: alone he enter'd
Was this the face that faced so many follies,
Was the first man that leap'd; cried, 'Hell is empty
Was that my father that went hence so fast?
Was stay'd by accident, and yesternight
Was stabb'd with bloody daggers: God, I pray him,
Was sent to by my brother; one Lucio
Was not our recompense, resting well assured
Was not my lord
Was not incensed by his subtle mother
Was not a man my father? Hadst thou foxship
Was not Gaunt just, and is not Harry true?
Was never widow had so dear a loss!
Was never mother had so dear a loss!
Was ne'er distributed.
Was my great father-in-law, renowned Warwick;
Was my beloved in Rome: yet thou behold'st!
Was mutually committed?
Was like to be the best.
Was it not to refresh the mind of man
Was it not so?
Was it not she and that good man of worship,
Was it more precious to me than 'tis now:
Was innocence for innocence; we knew not
Was in the wreck; and, but he's something stain'd
Was his great ancestor.
Was he met there? his train? Camillo with him?
Was grown into a hoop? hast thou forgot her?
Was fast belock'd in thine; this is the body
Was ever woman in this humour woo'd?
Was ever woman in this humour won?
Was ever son so rued a father's death?
Was ever match clapp'd up so suddenly?
Was ever man so proud as is this Marcius?
Was ever king so grieved for subjects' woe?
Was ever gentleman thus grieved as I?
Was ever father so bemoan'd his son?
Was ever book containing such vile matter
Was dukedom large enough: of temporal royalties
Was done to death? and more than so, my father,
Was crown'd in Paris but at nine months old.
Was brow-bound with the oak. His pupil age
Was aptly fitted and naturally perform'd.
Was Tybalt's dooms-day, whose untimely death
Was I then to you!
Was Duke of Milan; and thou his only heir
Was Ajax, call'd so from his grandfather.

Warwick, this is some post to us or thee.
Warwick, these words have turn'd my hate to love;
Warwick, although my head still wear the crown,
Warwick may lose, that now hath won the day.
Warwick is chancellor and the lord of Calais;
